messages: Good heavens! What was that?

dialog-demoend-cutscene-lasttime1.name: Beatrice
messages: Oh, no! This is just like last time!
Last time?

dialog-demoend-cutscene-lasttime3.name: Trekkie
messages: Last time Big Bad came!
Last time WHAT?
Oh, dear. Oh, goodness gracious.
I was afraid of this.
Afraid of WHAT?

I was afraid the Big Bad would notice what
you were doing.

You think the Big Bad somehow knows that
someone here has been using Ring Zero?

But it's been so long since the Big Bad
was seen at all! You think he might still
be out there, somewhere?
Perhaps.
What else does this earthquake mean?
Oh, dear.... Oh, dear!

But I can't fight the Big Bad! What am I
supposed to do?
I suppose... I suppose we must consider....
The other artifacts?
Dangerous. Dangerous, but....
*sigh*
We have no choice.

%PLAYER%, you must collect the
artifacts of power.

Just outside the town are three dungeons,
and at the end of each there is one
magical artifact.

That ring will not be enough to defeat
the Big Bad, but with those three
artifacts....
Yes, %PLAYER%!
You must go and retrieve them!
Go!
Next year.
Next... huh?
This has been DC801's badge game for 2020!

Thank you for playing, and we hope you'll
play the rest of the game next year!
Buh?

As a reward for completing the demo, I'll
tell you how to unlock debug mode.

Press XOR and MEM1 at the same time --
that's the top button on each side of the
screen -- and....
Voila!
(Zuh)
Show credits?

While you were gone, I saw an odd flash of
light coming from the library.
You might want to investigate.
Hey! Hey! My book!
There's this weird extra page in my book!

dialog-hexeditor-bonus.name: Hex Edits 2
messages:
-- allows us to copy and paste bytes using
something called a "Clip Bird.".

Pressing the circle button will copy a
single byte into the Clip Bird, but if you
hold circle, left and right will change
the number of bytes to be copied.

Pressing square will paste the contents of
the Clip Bird into the selected cell and
thereafter.

This has dramatically improved our
productivity!

Oh! I think I've heard of Clippy Bird! My
uncle let me play it on his phone this one
time, ages ago.
He said it was a really rare game.
